Questions.Question: Who wrote the satirical novel 'Catch-22'?
Questions.Explanation: Joseph Heller's 'Catch-22' critiques the absurdity of war and bureaucracy, popularizing the term 'catch-22' to describe paradoxical situations.

Questions.Question: Which literary work satirizes totalitarianism with 'Newspeak' language?
Questions.Explanation: George Orwell's '1984' uses Newspeak to criticize the control of language and thought in totalitarian regimes.

Questions.Question: In 'Don Quixote,' what does the titular character mistake windmills for?
Questions.Explanation: Mistaking windmills for giants, Don Quixote satirizes chivalric romance and delusional idealism in a changing world.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the satirical novel 'Animal Farm'?
Questions.Explanation: George Orwell's 'Animal Farm' allegorizes the Russian Revolution, exposing political corruption through anthropomorphized farm animals.

Questions.Question: Which author's satirical work features the fictitious land of Lilliput?
Questions.Explanation: Jonathan Swift's 'Gulliver's Travels' satirizes society and politics, using Lilliput to critique British government and customs.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the satirical play 'The Importance of Being Earnest'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde's 'The Importance of Being Earnest' uses witty dialogue and satire to mock Victorian social conventions and hypocrisy.

Questions.Question: Which comedic novel features the characters Ignatius J. Reilly and Myrna Minkoff?
Questions.Explanation: John Kennedy Toole's 'A Confederacy of Dunces' satirizes societal norms through the eccentric and comedic protagonist, Ignatius J. Reilly.

Questions.Question: Who created the satirical character of Bertie Wooster and his valet, Jeeves?
Questions.Explanation: P.G. Wodehouse's stories with Bertie Wooster and Jeeves employ humor and satire to depict the antics of the British upper class.

Questions.Question: Which satirical drama addresses the absurdity of modern society through the character of Yossarian?
Questions.Explanation: Joseph Heller's 'Catch-22' humorously critiques the irrationality of war and bureaucracy, centering on the disillusioned protagonist Yossarian.

Questions.Question: In 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy,' what is the title of the fictional and satirical guidebook?
Questions.TrueAnswer: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Questions.Explanation: Douglas Adams' sci-fi comedy uses 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' as a humorous and satirical commentary on human behavior and society.
